main event: On August 7, 1952 in North Alabama, a USAF pilot observed a white, round, stationary object while flying at an altitude of approximately 11,000 feet. The object appeared to be stationary and remained in sight for approximately 30 minutes.
interesting points: The white object did not exhibit characteristics of any known aircraft or meteor, leading to its unidentified classification.
The object did not reflect any light and appeared to be stationary throughout the observation.
The pilot observed the object while flying in a northeasterly direction, and its nature and origin remained unknown.
The pilot, Captain Landers, had nearly nine years of military service and was considered capable and dependable in his assignments.
The report involved a civil air patrol flight and the observers consisted of credible, trained military personnel.
